snippet: Arvo Pärt’s compositions are not only universally spiritual, but specific to the Eastern Orthodox Christian Church, though he prefers to remain vague on that topic.
abstract: Work of Estonian composer Arvo Part, whose compositions are both universally spiritual and specific to Eastern Orthodox Christianity, will be performed for first time in 30 years in New York; series, called Arvo Part Project, will include panel events and academic collaborations.
lead_paragraph: Arvo Pärt’s compositions are not only universally spiritual, but specific to the Eastern Orthodox Christian Church, though he prefers to remain vague on that topic.

headline.main: His Music, Entwined With His Faith
